definition: strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
diagram/picture/drawing/chart/map/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to plan/to scheme/to attempt/to pursue/to seek

sentences.english: Last year’s sales figures for all our markets are shown on this bar chart.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有市场去年的销售数字都显示在这个条形图上。

sentences.english: In this case, I'm specifying the chart type as a bar chart.
sentences.chinese: 在这个例子中，我将图表的类型指定为条形图。

sentences.english: The bar chart range is indicates desired targets for each phase of the pipeline.
sentences.chinese: 条形图的范围代表的是此渠道的各个阶段的预期目标。

sentences.english: Narrow bars without a number value indicate that no target is in those states.
sentences.chinese: 不含数字值的窄条形图表示没有目标处于该状态。

sentences.english: The bar chart below shows the cost of buying three different photocopiers.
sentences.chinese: 以下条形图显示购买三种不同复印机所需的费用。

sentences.english: You can check Stingray operation with the built-in LCD bar graph display.
sentences.chinese: 您可以检查𫚉加强与内置LCD条形图显示。

sentences.english: Double-click the gray bar for the group to which you assigned the documents.
sentences.chinese: 双击文档被分配到的那个内容组的灰色条形图标。

sentences.english: The chart indicates status by color, as well as position in the summary bar.
sentences.chinese: 图表使用颜色以及摘要条形图中的位置来表示状态。

definition: to fit (data to a model)/a (close) fit
